qns.bb84 package¶

Submodules¶

qns.bb84.device module¶

class qns.bb84.device.PhotonNode(registers_number: int = - 1, name=None)¶

Bases: qns.topo.basic.Node

This is a quantum node that can send or receive a single photon

Parameters

  • registers_number -- the size of its quantum registers. Not used now.

  • name -- its name

Variables

  • registers -- its quantum memory

  • links -- attached quantum channels (optical fiber).

class qns.bb84.device.PhotonRandomSendProtocol(entity, rate=1, start_time=None, end_time=None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

It is a protocol for PhotonNode. It will generate new photon and send it periodly.

Parameters

  • entity -- the PhotonNode.

  • rate -- the photon generation rate.

  • start_time -- the photon generation will start at start_time.

  • end_time -- the photon generation will stop at end_time.

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

handle is one of the callback functions that can be used to handle the triggered event.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- anything, can be considered as the event's parameters

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

run(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, event: qns.schedular.event.Event)¶

Generate a new photon and send it on its channel.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • event -- the event that calls this devices to generate and send new photon.

class qns.bb84.device.PhotonReceiveAndMeasureProtocol(entity)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

It is a protocol for PhotonNode. It will receive the coming photon and measure it. Then, it will print its polarization

Parameters

entity -- the PhotonNode.

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

The handle function will receive new photon and print its polarization

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- the coming photon

  • source -- the photon sender

  • event -- the event that calls this function

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

qns.bb84.event module¶

class qns.bb84.event.GenerationAndSendEvent(protocol, source=None, init_time: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.event.Event

This event is generated by PhotonRandomSendProtocol. It is used to periodly generate new photon and send it.

Parameters

  • protocol -- a PhotonRandomSendProtocol

  • source -- the sender quantum node

  • init_time -- the event's generation time.

run(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

This event will call PhotonRandomSendProtocol's run function to generate and send new photon.

class qns.bb84.event.PhotonReceiveEvent(to, new_photon, source=None, init_time: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.event.Event

This event is generated by a PhotonReceiveEvent. The fiber generate this event to notify the receiver to receive the coming photon.

Parameters

  • to -- the photon receiver

  • new_photon -- the sender photon

  • source -- the photon sender

  • init_time -- the event's generation time.

run(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

This event will call PhotonReceiveAndMeasureProtocol's handle function to receive the photon and measure it

qns.bb84.fiber module¶

class qns.bb84.fiber.OpticalFiber(nodes=[], name=None)¶

Bases: qns.topo.basic.Channel

The quantum optical fiber to tranfer a photon.

Parameters

  • nodes -- quantum nodes that it is attached to

  • name (str) -- its name

class qns.bb84.fiber.OpticalFiberProtocol(entity, delay=0, possible=1, rate=None, max_onfly=None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

The protocol for optical fiber. It transfer a photon from one side to another.

Parameters

  • entity -- a quantum optical fiber

  • delay -- its delay time in second

  • possible -- its transmission success rate

  • rate -- how many photon it can transfer per second

  • max_onfly -- how many photon it can cached for sending. Over this bound, the new coming photon will be dropped.

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

Transmit a photon in msg and send it to another node.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- the sending photon

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

qns.bb84.photon module¶

class qns.bb84.photon.Basis(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Basis is the quantum basis

Variables

  • X -- X basis

  • Z -- Z basis

X = 1¶
Z = 0¶
class qns.bb84.photon.Photon¶

Bases: object

This is a single photon

Variables

  • is_superposition_state (bool) -- whether this photon is in super position state

  • polar (Polar) -- its polar state

  • name (str) -- its name

measure(basis: qns.bb84.photon.Basis)¶

Measure its polarization using selected basis.

Parameters

basis (Basis) -- the selected basis

Returns

1 or 0 to present its polarization. -2 means not been measured.

preparation(polar: qns.bb84.photon.Polar)¶

Set this photon into certain polarization

Parameters

polar (Polar) -- its polarizaion

random_measure() → Tuple[qns.bb84.photon.Basis, qns.bb84.photon.Polar]¶

randomly use a basis measure its linear polarization

Returns

the basis and the polar

random_preparation() → Tuple[qns.bb84.photon.Basis, qns.bb84.photon.Polar]¶

randomly use a basis and generate the transmit its linear polarization

Returns

the basis and the polar

class qns.bb84.photon.Polar(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Polar is the quantum state of a single photon

Variables

  • H -- |1> state

  • V -- |0> state

  • P -- |+> state

  • Q -- |-> state

  • A -- Any state

  • N -- Not be measured

A = -2¶
H = 1¶
N = -1¶
P = 3¶
Q = 2¶
V = 0¶

Module contents¶

A single photon network model for BB84 and other QKD protocols.
